en_text: Isn't that a wonderful thing?!
jp_text: それは とても すばらしいことでしょう？
google_translated: Is that very wonderful?

en_text: If you think so, then move out of the way!!!
jp_text: そう思うなら そこをどいてよ！

en_text: I will not.

en_text: ...move out of the way if you don't want to die!!!

en_text: Stop...
jp_text: やめて…

en_text: Stop... already...

en_text: Stop already...

en_text: She said she had no choice but to die.

en_text: Neither does she want to die, nor should she.

google_translated: Even if "I want to die" is not "the dead"

en_text: She had no choice but to die.
jp_text: “死ぬしかない”だ
google_translated: "I have no choice but to die"

en_text: Isn't there any other choice?
jp_text: 何か ほかに選択肢はないのか
google_translated: Is there anything else other option?

en_text: Think.
jp_text: 考えよう　新たな…

en_text: To stop the experiment, I must let them realize that nothing good will come out of the experiment.
jp_text: 実験を止めるには…
google_translated: To stop the experiment ...

en_text: Looking for a very faint miracle to happen, misaka's sister moves toward the experiment location.
jp_text: ほんの僅かな奇跡を求めて 御坂妹は実験場へと向かう

en_text: Awaiting her there is the Academy City's strongest Level 5.
